name: Grandma's Chocolate Texas Sheet Cake
author: Bekah Miller
summary: This is hands-down my all-time favorite cake! I fell in love making it after my grandmother shared the recipe with me. This cake is super quick, easy, and fun to make! Definitely recommend this for first time bakers and anyone else who would love to take a bite out of a delicious chocolate Texas sheet cake.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease and flour a 10x15-inch cake pan
Combine butter, water, and cocoa powder for cake in a saucepan over medium heat
Cook until butter has melted and mixture comes to a boil
Remove from the heat and cool slightly
Meanwhile, mix flour, sugar, and salt together in a large bowl
Beat buttermilk, eggs, baking soda, and vanilla extract together in a separate bowl
Add melted butter mixture to the flour mixture, then add buttermilk-egg mixture and beat until thoroughly combined
Pour into the prepared cake pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes
Remove cake from the oven and cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes
Meanwhile, combine butter, milk, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract for the frosting in a saucepan over medium heat
Stir until butter melts, then stir in powdered sugar
Spread frosting over the warm cake
